operations.notes: In order to get the value of a parameter, call /bs/get?ParamName. As ParamName you can give any parameter name from the following list: dlarq, ularq, hlharq1, dlharq2, ulharq1, ulharq2, ackchannels, sachallengetimer, sachallengemaxresend, teklifetime, tekchangeovertime, insecurestationallowed, pkmv1allowed, pkmv2allowed, aeswrap, noencryption, resourceretaintimeout, idlemodetimeout, resourceholdtimeout, maxulallocation, maxdlallocation, dlulgap, uldlgap, numexpectedss, regtimeout, phyenabled, maxreprspfails, txpower, rngreqtimeout, bwmode, dlulratio, rangeframe, fftsize, useframe1, useframe2, useframe3, useframe4, hotimetotrigger, txpowerlimitenabled, txpowerlimit, ranginginterval, dregcmdwait, dregcmdretries, dlpermutationbase, reportingbase, powercontrolmode, niieperiod, maxtxpowerbackoff, carriersensehysteresis, carriersenseperiod, privmapmode, fbscanenabled, type, useallsubchannels, maxproportion, permutationbase, stccode, stcmatrix, acmtype, dedicatedpilots, slotsdivup, slotsdivdl
